page.title: 15A FARMERS DAY cont
page.content: tanking ,rolling and harrowing and re-seeding.At very busy times of the year,like silaging time,the farmer has to work from very early in the morning to late at night,cutting the grass and bringing it in to the silo to be stored for winter feed for the cows. At 4 pm it is time to milk the cows for the 2nd time.Ben,the sheep dog, runs off eagerly to round the cows up.While the cows are being milked ,the farm worker moves the electric fence to give fresh grass for the night .Afternoon milking is usally finished by 5:30pm but after the evening meal there are still jobs to be done such as looking at in - calf cows ,looking at the fields to decide which field the cows are going in next.It can sometimes be a long and tiring day but most farmers enjoy it.
